Yik'in Chan K'awiil also known as Ruler B, Yaxkin Caan Chac and Sun Sky Rain,, was an ajaw of the Maya city of Tikal. Identified by Mayanist epigraphers as the 27th ruler in Tikal's dynastic succession, Yik'in Chan K'awiil was one of Tikal's most successful and expansionary rulers, consolidating the political gains won by his father, Jasaw Chan K'awiil I. During his reign prolific building works were undertaken at Tikal, with a number of the site's significant still-standing structures commissioned or extended under his direction. Before advances in the decipherment of the Maya script revealed this reading of his name, this ruler was also known to researchers as Tikal Ruler B. Yik'in K'awiil conquered Calakmul in 736 and two other Calakmul allies in 743 and 744. His principal wife was a princess of Palenque, her personal name is unknown, but her formal title was Lady Yax Ahau Xoc. It is unknown exactly where his tomb lies, but strong archaeological parallels between Burial 116 and Burial 196, located in the diminutive pyramid immediately south of Tikal Temple II and referred to as Structure 5D-73, suggest the latter may be the tomb of Yik'in Chan Kawiil.

Yaxkin leads a conquest focused Mayan civilization, especially targeted towards city-states.
-
While the Mayan Civlization's abilities are normally suited towards science and faith, Yaxkin Caan Chac's strength lies in the Hadzab unique unit and his "Darken the Sky" ability. Conquest of citystates and foreign civilizations will drive the Maya forward, not only through production and science bonuses but also acquisition of Great People. Conquests easily lead to more, as taking a city will result in the production necessary to field even greater armies.
